p.seg: One who has grasped meaning remains speechless (unable to articulate adequately what he has grasped);
someone who gets to make progress in understanding something also remains speechless.
Making speechlessness one's mode of communication is also itself again a mode of linguistic communication.
just as making docta ignorantia [Latin: "learned ignorance"] one's knowledge is also itself again (a mode of) knowledge.
No matter whether there is speech or speechlessness
knowledge or ignorance
in all these cases there are modes of linguistic communication of modes of understanding.
At the same time there is nothing unsaid
and there is nothing ununderstood!
And (funnily enough) at the same time there nothing said (when something is "said")
and likewise there is nothing that is understood (when something is "understood".)
This is how things stand, and that is all there is to be said.
Why are you people pointlessly upset?
Master Liezi said:
To maintain that (the universe of) Heaven and Earth will perish is mistaken,
and to maintain that (the universe of) Heaven and Earth will not perish is equally mistaken:
Whether (Heaven and Earth) will perish or not
is something that one is incapable of ascertaining.
This may be so, but
the former (the future destruction of Heaven and Earth) is one (proposition),
the latter (the non-destruction of Heaven and Earth in the future) is another (proposition).
But the fact is that the living have no understanding of the dead,
and the dead have no understanding of the living.
those who have come have no understanding of those who have gone,
and those who have gone (out of existence) have no understanding of those who have come (into existence).
Whether Heaven and Earth will perish or won't perish,
how should one have what it takes to judge that question?
When Master Liezi learnt about this he said with a smile:
